newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Treasury sets state note coupons.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Treasury sets state note coupons.

text.p: The Belgian Treasury said in a statement that it had set the coupons for its next issue of five year notes, extendable for seven years, at 4.50 percent.

For its 3/5/7 year note with revisable rate and guaranteed minimum coupon it set the first coupon at 3.70 percent, the first minimum guaranteed coupon at 4.60 percent and the second minimum guaranteed coupon at 5.25 percent.
The 3/5/7 note has put options at three, five and seven years.
Subscriptions to the issue run from March 11 to March 17, and payment day is March 18.
This is the fourth issue of such state notes. The last issue, in December, raised eight billion Belgian francs.
